revised_title: Investigating Lung Ventilation during Chloroform Narcosis
tldr: The authors investigate the effect of chloroform anesthesia on lung ventilation and find that the decrease in oxy-hemoglobin levels during chloroform narcosis is not solely due to a slowing of respiration. They use a plethysmograph to measure lung ventilation and determine that the decrease in oxygen content in the blood is likely due to the direct interference of chloroform with the oxygen transport function of red blood cells.
